Title: "Please read this before joining Walmart Labs India"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: although free lunch was provided by many companies  walmart s lunch is a step ahead from others with a wide variety of options  they also provide non veg everyday  but  the food quality has degraded a lot since the time i joined  i don t know whether they are monitoring it or not   the second thing i like the most are inhouse pantry for each floor  they are always stocked up food  drinks etc  we even have xbox in the pantry as well   in summary  anything related to food is good at walmart   those are pros  i would say
Negative_Review: first of all  after spending time at walmart i understood that the work experience you get is highly dependent of the team you are going in  unfortunately  i landed in very bad team and my experience was very bad   all the things related to work for me are bad    showing partiality to some people  not recognising the people for their efforts  rewards system was never clear (rewards are always given to people who puts butter to the manager) and to add it all  the managers are the worst   they don't know what the team members are doing   no clarity on what the road map is for future  i am under 3 managers in my tenure  out of these 3 only the last manager was decent enough  the first 2 are horrible i should say  the less i talk about this work  the better it is   and coming to policies  the hr team says they have innovated the policies for covid situation and all   but in reality all they have done add a small clause to the existing    i will give you an example   there was a fitness reimbursement policy of 1500/pm initially when i joined  they converted it to 18000/py (you can use as much as you can but it is limited to 18k per year) and called it innovated   all they have done is lifted the monthly limit  now  after covid wfh situation they said that we can buy a computer chair and all   but in reality that again was included in fitness reimbursement  so  fitness + chiar is 18k per year   how funny it is  it is obvious that no body is going to gym during covid    they just adjusted that amount to chair and calling it innovative  there are many like this   so  in short any thing related to work/policies are horrible for me

Title: "Pharmacy team review"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: 1  good facilities - free food  free cab  year end gift  team outings  fun activities  2  some really good people to work with  they are good both technically and behaviorally  3  good learning for the first few months after you join  4  good salary  5  work life balance(depends on team)
Negative_Review: 1  no work life balance(depends) 2  some very arrogant people who have no respect for others  3  too much politics/favouritism  if you are somebody's favorite you will get good work  good visibility and good hike   4  more than the quality of work what matters is  a  if you can respond to slack messages at nights(very important) just to show you are online   b  your interaction with senior folks like senior managers  managers or architects even if you are not reporting to them directly (just to suck up)  5  after few months of work there isn't much to learn  it's the same repetitive work  6  forced bell curve  7  lot of blame game     my advice  if you are a candidate who feel your work should matter the most don't join pharmacy team  but if you are a person for whom other things matter more then welcome aboard

Title: "Worst Experience - Total waste of one year"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: compensation slightly above average  absolutely nothing apart from that
Negative_Review: junk work  poor management  no respect for employees   joined this company thinking i would get to do impactful data science work  but the reality is nowhere close to that  you will be hired as a data scientist but given junk engineering/deployment work  the justification for that from the management is   "if you are designing a machine learning model it is your responsibility to see it is deployed into production"  and that is not a straight forward process because there is no process of things work here  everyone will invent their own process pushing thousands of junk code to production repositories which can break any day only to frustrate another ill fated engineer who attempts to clean up this mess  end result you will end up wasting months doing junk engineering work  navigating through inconsistencies in dependencies  if something doesn't work in the dependencies you are having you are expected to fix that too  you are expected to work on call for a system you have no idea what is going on  if something goes wrong you are responsible  the blame game is strong  there is no learning component to the job  you will build a basic version of some well known models and get frustrated getting that to production

Title: "IDC Leaders should be in politics rather being in IT Industry"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: * flexible working hours * good employee benefits in terms of medical insurance  free food  free transportation   quarterly team outing (company pays 5k+ inr per person   but again this depends on your manager  if s/he is adamant to go outing  your money will go in vain)  udemy premium account for learning purpose   cultural events  last but not the least a top brand
Negative_Review: recruiters think that they are the king of the world  (dhidha is a hint   if you are an employee of walmart  you would understand whom i am referring)  the worst thing you will experience is that "you will get a bigger surprise on the joining day as they would put in a different team than the team for which you were hired"   if you do a survey on this  why people at walmart leave in 1 1 5 years  many employees would come up with the above reason    they have degraded their standard of hiring process   few years back  they used to hire only from tier 1 colleges  now it has become like anyone with java tech stack can be part of walmart  okay  it's a good thing that you are giving a good opportunity  to everyone  but  have some plans for the people whom you hire    coming to the point which would signify the review title    i was part of a team which had two sets of leaders  idc & us  my team was an experimental team to experiment a new model of working  and this idea had come from us leaders  idc leaders were so mean towards this   they were not ready to accept this team's existence   in a nutshell  us leaders were trying so hard to succeed and idc leaders were trying so hard to fail this model    just to disrupt the balance in the team  idc leader says these kind of statements in team meeting that we don't have a budget for these many members    to my surprise  when i resigned   idc leaders says that i took a right decision  anyways  this team is going to be dissolved     politics happen almost at all the organizations  but here it crossed every limits    in a nutshell  i would say walmart sucks

Title: "Good to work If you don't have career Vision"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: - work life balance for those who does not want to work - big brand to associate with  - bunch of free things i e free food  free transport  internet reimbursement  (non of these value to an associate  it s for company to show and get the tax benefit - annual gift worth of 3000 inr - business class flight to us or any international travel for any business trip ( you can experience emirates a380 business class flight  ) )
Negative_Review: not quality work    too much politics and power play    some of the sr  leader are worst they do lot of favoritism to their groups and promote them like distributing lollypop to the kids  i have seen many promotions happen just aligning people and narrating a fake story on achievement and accomplishments about the people  i would strongly suggest hr or sr leaders to keep on close eye to this      since wm india rapidly expanding the hiring quality is very much gone down and lot of wrong hiring happening  due to wrong panel and the influence     no process and best engineering practices followed  people love to execute works through vendor so that they can just enjoy the work life balance     salary structure is not very good  they show the tctc figure as very high where as an employees salary is actually an average industry standard      proper appraisal and review process not been followed  though they have good tool and process in place  due to poor management (people managers) they don't follow it properly  hence one can't get the career feedback timely     have seen people managers easily can do a soft target or retaliate through bell curve process  it's predetermined who will go into as bottom performer  if they want to target someone as bottom performer  they will stop engaging that associate in good or engaging projects so that he will not get enough opportunity or data point to present during review cycle  this is how systems are misused  in my view bell curve is not used in proper sense  it's used to fire people who are not in the good fold of the managers or sr  leaders     they have associate engagement score  but never seen in action or taken appropriate steps on the associates feedback  it's purely controlled and manipulated

Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: free lunch  cab team outings  team lunch/dinner
Negative_Review: extremely poor work culture  managers show favouritism and are blind towards any feedback given for their "favourites"  visibility and credit of work is only given to the leads while the developers are considered mere working class  most importantly  they follow forced bell curve for employee rating  which means that even if you are accomplishing all your goals  you may not even receive an average rating  causing all the employees to run a rat race  do not believe the recruiters/hrs when they say that everyone gets at least an average rating  no! only 50% employees can get the average rating  a very huge segment of your ctc is based on your rating  if your rating falls below average  you get no raise and a very small portion of your variable pay as well as rsus

Title: "Detailed review on work culture"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time
Positive_Review: - they pay more than you want - free cab - reimburse internet bills - free snacks and food
Negative_Review: meetings  meetings  meetings  meetings everywhere   you spend 60% of your life talking (even if you don’t like to talk)  10% of your life attending team outings  team offsite  events like security awareness  diversity awareness  etc   remaining 30% you code     if you tell your manager there are 5 critical production issues that we should address asap   your manager will say   that’s not a high priority  first please prepare 2019 roadmap and tell me what are your thoughts for next year     there will be at least one or two meetings in a week you are or manager talking about next year road map   even after the year is born  once the year is born   you will start talking about next next year     you will never understand what are your roles and responsibilities  another person or even another team will be doing the same thing without your knowledge     few directors also attend stand up meetings along with engineering manager  program manager and scrum master to hear 4 poor engineers’ status  everybody will ask you status in different occasions  different dimensions  your director  your manager  program manager  program manager’s manager  product manager and group product manager  you will spend most of your time explaining them what you are doing and very less time in actually working     it’s normal to see meetings like program sync up   where you will see 40+ attendees looking at an excel sheet over an hour long meeting     no one comes to meetings on time  it's pretty normal to show up on a meeting 10 to 12 mins late  you don’t have to apologise     it's pretty normal to have status calls with us counterparts as late as 10 30 ist / 11 00 pm ist  they don’t even ask you for a courtesy if it’s too late or not     no one knows what is agile here  you can see stories estimated as 3 5 pds  6 5 pds  a lot of them don’t even know there is something called story points  if you tell them about story points they make fun of you     engineers to non engineers ratio is pretty bad and hence it's very counter productive   for example a team of 10 engineers will have 3 qa folks  1 devops person (this is how they understand devops here by the way)  1 track product owner  1 program manager  1 engineering manager  0 5 director  0 5 group product owner  0 5 initiative product owners (~3 nos)  0 5 principal engineer   so in the end   non engineers are 3+1+1+1+1+6*0 5 = 10 non engineers   that means 10 engineers are coding and 10 non engineers are reviewing or just discussing those 10 engineers’ work

Title: "Not a great environment to grow"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years

Title: "Lack of opportunities and recognition"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: - good perks like free food  cabs and transport  frequent team outings  - training opportunities are good
Negative_Review: some teams have no roadmaps or goals  there is a lack of good projects  the culture is to come up with your own projects and execute them or only work on supporting existing projects  coming up with projects requires various levels of approvals and is not easy    lack of recognition  only those who work long hours are appreciated and not those who deliver    not everyone's idea's or inputs are considered  there seems to be favoritism    it is not very easy to interact with other teams if the work requires to do so    traveling using office transport is not convenient due to fixed  inflexible timings

Title: "Software Development Engineer-II"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: the company policies are really good  they compensate the associates quite well  reimbursements for travelling  phone  wifi etc are given  the working hours are quite flexible and completely varies from team to team  the food is simply awesome
Negative_Review: you can't change your team within 18 months of joining the company  the teams are also assigned randomly  the work is not really the best and most of the people who have experience in working in walmart are mediocre at best  their yearly reviews are a joke and a strict policy of enforced bell curve is followed  so  you will see people not at all working getting higher ratings than those who are doing really good job  all in accordance with the team  the hiring is on an insane level and the company is really over crowded  it's really difficult to shine in such a large crowd

Title: "software engineer (walmart or walmartlabs or @labs... so many confusion)"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart  for more than 3 years

Negative_Review: oh i don't think there is any  except  1  no respect for good and talented staffs   2  upper management are busy doing us trips and accumulating money as much as possible  coz they them self knows they won't get any  once fired from here  3  unnecessary cluttered of managers  absolutely wrong hires  4  no idea whom to promote  one of my colleagues promotion was announced in his last day  awesome isn't it         many more

Title: "Be aware!! Walmart Global Tech. Services(GTS) is worst in all Walmart Divisions"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart
Positive_Review: except free food & transport  no pros
Negative_Review: first of all  others reviews about walmart gts have been given by manager's flatterers  they write good review & show to managers  managers themselves have no work to do in office  they are full free whole day & be aware   and portray good images of lazy gts employees to the global management  but wrong thing cannot be hidden for too long in private sector  i bet  this gts center will get shut down by top management someday very soon  walmart e commerce & walmart labs are nice place to work  never join gts    note   gts is an extension to walmart isd division which is walmart's it team in us  my whole review is about isd team at bangalore  1  hrs are useless  2  will get promoted or importance if you are licking the feet of managers  if you are showing fake smiles n fake good morning to each one in gts 3  cheap politics  they hire telgu people only  if you are non telgu then you have to keep licking feet of telgu people in order to keep your job intact   4  overall compensation or ctc looks big in offer letter  that's a trick to make you food  out of ctc  20% component is variable pay  which they never pay  15% is company shares  which they pay after four year   5  you will find many people who has no work but just stay highlighted & maintain their visibility with non sense loud conversations or sending junk mails to whole company eveyday  6  if those people who spends 2 3+ years here  80% will not be able to get any job outside as they did not nothing but enjoyed in these years   7  management is a big liar  there are three division  walmart gts  walmart e commerce & walmart labs  management never accepts that these are different & say we are one  but facilities & compensation is far different in gts & very low  for example  gts has to fill timesheets while other two division has no timesheet at all  you may easily see labs people enjoying luxury lunch party every weeks while gts people have no parties at all

Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart  for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: 1  it was a great initiative to build ecommerce for international market  2  and complete work was done in india with vendors like wipro  infy  cts       3  good opportunity was given for initial wal-mart employees and they were responsible for complete deliverables  4  responsible and were free to make decisions  5  good india leadership <<before 2012>>
Negative_Review: 1  4 ~ 5 top level management changes within 2 years of time 2  wal mart bangalore was treated as a execution center  once mgmt changed  3  lots of people started visiting india  to see and evaluate the work being done  4  most of the senior wal mart employees left the company   5  few sr directors  were playing favoritism 6  for good  imminent and capable people  opportunities were limited  7  all useless people are in the panel

Title: "cashier"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: if you re looking for a first job and want to fully take on a challenge then this is the job for you  you ll gain a lot of guest service experience with all the walks of life that comes in through the doors  some of the staff members are a delight and others    well   not as much  they are super flexible with your hours  but let them know a month in advance if you would like to change your schedule  overall it is challenging because of the management and customers  but with a little patience and a build of thicker skin then this is the place for you

Title: "Working for Walmart"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time
Positive_Review: most of the pros come from the work you do  if you re lucky enough to get a nice position  then the work will be fulfilling  the interactions with the other associates are well worth it  the benefits might be the best pro of all  although you have to wait three months for your first benefit  the 10% discount card  plenty of other benefits roll in on your 3  6  and your 12 month work anniversaries  me personally  i work in the electronics department  which can honestly be debated as the best department to work in  i love technology and games and i love it when i get to explain something to someone and they leave with more knowledge than when they left  the work i do is very interesting and fulfilling
Negative_Review: now the cons are not that long but they do make a big difference with your experience  the one problem that i've always had with walmart is the management  i've worked at walmart since june of 2017 and since day one  i knew i was gonna have a hard time with the managers  some managers you'll meet are amazing and awesome to work with  other managers will be the polar opposite  the management situation is so bad that on several occasions  i've almost quit on the spot  sometimes they can be so frustrating  some managers step out of line which unfortunately is what has happened to me and a couple of other associates i know  overall  i believe that with all the pros  they slightly outway the cons of working here  i gave them 3 stars because over the past 6 8 months  it's gotten worse and that is the reason i've been actively looking for another job  to quote my friend once  "i love the work i do  but  i don't like who i do it for"

Title: "Pretty Decent For A Little While"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
authorInfo: Former Employee - CAP Team II Associate, Stocker
Positive_Review: pretty easy job once you got the hang of it  the coworkers were all really nice and friendly  management was nice as well up to a certain point  the pay was decent compared to other jobs around town  even though it looks like i have more cons  it s mostly just ranting
Negative_Review: the starting pay is $11 an hour for any position and they don't do hazard pay  not even when the virus was at its peak  which was when i was working there  they gave us $150 dollar bonus and that was it  it is better than a lot of places right now but i thought i should mention that  it was hard to plan family events around my scheduled hours since i worked right in the middle of the day  i pretty much never saw my family until they were about to go to bed  i wanted a night shift position but this was what was offered to me so i took it  the customers were sometimes rude for no reason but that's expected at this type of job  i was a temporary employee for covid so i got no benefits while working  which was also expected  i failed a temperature check and had to stay home for 10 days as a precaution but during those 10 days  they took all my hours off of the schedule  even the ones that i was supposed to work when i got back  when i tried to put them back on the schedule they were removed within a couple of hours  they never told me what was going on or tried to contact me  so i don't know what happened and i guess i'll never really know

Title: "Overall Good Experience"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: - some really good benefits (5 month maternity leave  $ a day schooling for high school and bachelor s degrees  unlimited pto in some locations  free linkedin learnings  store discount  discounts on travel/cruises etc )  - bonus - for salaried employees  they pay based on individual performance combined with company performance  this makes for some really high bonuses when the company does really well or if you perform really well    - culture (in some department/locations) - the departments that i worked for had a positive environment and i ve created some really amazing friendships through my work associations   -company consistently does things to stay relevant and try to stay ahead of the competition   - more career opportunities now that a lot of opportunities are  remote  positions but because there are so many employees it s more difficult to scale the ranks
Negative_Review: honestly  i overall had a great experience working for walmart  i don't all of the layoffs they've done in 2020 across the business but that's something that comes with running a business   it's also easy to feel like you are just a number and replaceable  this is a comment for senior leadership across the org  your experience there can really depend on your senior leadership  i've had experiences with amazing senior leadership where i felt like i was getting developed  i had opportunities  my manager had my back  etc  but i've also had experiences where leadership is unorganized  apathetic about your development  and doesn't care if you stay or leave  this makes it discouraging to do your best when you don't see any opportunities there for you at the company and is ultimately why i left

Title: "Please ask questions! Demand what you want!"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
authorInfo: Former Employee - Customer Service Associate/Cashier & Money Center Associate
Positive_Review: pay ok  variety of locations  occasional lunch around the holidays
Negative_Review: must have weekend availability or else you will not receive any hours  upper department management loves to micromanage  need constant key turns  for returns/exchanges  coupon scammers/thief  they prey on new workers  front desk is disorganized  worked 30+ hours/week with no benefits  ridiculous point system  beware of trying to get days off  likely to not be approved  (yes  even unpaid time off) long hours on feet  little to no down  time  constantly moving  do not care about revolving school schedule for students

Title: "It's a job..basic job"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 10 years
Positive_Review: it s easy work  you dont have to be a genius and there are opportunities for advancement  if you can stand upper mgmt on your back constantly
Negative_Review: upper mgmt on your back some micromanage   they play favorites  if you're not on that list count on a tough day  every day  they're "restructuring" which simply means they're eliminating supervisory positions and cutting your pay because your new position in the store can pay much less  for example a customer service supervisor making $16 17/hr will make only $12 13/hr regardless of how long you've worked there  they do this every couple of yrs  an asset mgr makes $45k a co mgr $65k and store mgr $85 90k

Title: "The experience and work is important but still not a career setting."
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: training is very thorough and prepares you for all of the basics with step by step instructions such as proper scanning  bagging  etc   you fill out hours of availability as part of the paperwork so they know when you re comfortable working and you are also allowed to change it in the future if the need arises  the work is flexible and management does not complain if you cut corners and just bag everything by shapes to speed up your line  also  i live only about 10 minutes from my work site and pretty often see people i know shopping that can  visit  while i m working which makes the experience a little more special than my last job which was privately held
Negative_Review: the job is secretly part time even though i checked off both permanent and full time on the paperwork during the open interview/ job fair period  (my job coaches had to inform me it is at least very unlikely to ever lead to full time  ) you are required to work almost every single weekend if available once you're roughly a month into the experience and can handle longer lines  you are required to work some major holidays like thanksgiving and may be scheduled to work earlier than your hours of availability on those days

Title: "The experience and work is important but still not a career setting."

Negative_Review: the job is secretly part time even though i checked off both permanent and full time on the paperwork during the open interview/ job fair period  (my job coaches had to inform me it is at least very unlikely to ever lead to full time  ) you are required to work almost every single weekend if available once you're roughly a month into the experience and can handle longer lines  you are required to work some major holidays like thanksgiving and may be scheduled to work earlier than your hours of availability on those days

Title: "Preference..."
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time
Positive_Review: 1 ) you can take your break anywhere in or outside of the store  just don t leave the lot because the breaks are only 10-15 mins  2 ) access w-2 forms on computer/smartphone  3 ) store really clean  floor super shiny  unless it s winter
Negative_Review: 1 ) you'll be relieved from duty to take break or lunch    if you are lucky! most of the time your replacement is taking a century to show up  2 ) if you have history of back pains  weak arms and legs  unable to lift 20 lbs  this isn't the job for you  injured on site and filing for workers comp will result you receiving a write up and you can only have 3 max  3 ) walmart doesn't care about their workers well beings  cut throat savages! 4 ) day and afternoon dept /managers are nice but if you are nights or overnights they're jerks  5 ) if you have a history of dental problems    you mightest well get your own dental insurance because walmart insurance doesn't cover jack  not even 6 months teeth cleaning

Title: "Overworked and Underpaid"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: if your lucky  you could have nice coworkers  who will tell you the truth about working at walmart  and they will help you develop because your operational manager will not care to train you  there is also a big bonus but you have to suffer a year to get that
Negative_Review: there is no work  life balance  you work 14 17hrs a day depending on which schedule you pick  the area manager gets handed all of the assignments/projects from upper management  and on top of that you have to deal with your area manager responsibilities  while making sure you reach your goal for the day   when you want a vacation they will ask why?  do not ever accept the first offer  because you will regret it after working long hours and working on your off days when the season hits   area managers have to calculate every move  get comfortable with associates always being right even when they are at fault   pray that you get a "good" operational manager  or even a coworker who will train you on the job  you will be thrown in the ocean with sharks (associates) who will want to see you fail  especially when you are new to the company  if you want to work to the top  you have to carry on more projects and there is no team at that point  its all about making yourself good

Title: "They'll do anything to not fire you"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: you don t have to work hard to be given better opportunities or even promotions  the more useless you are  the more likely you are to be given administrative positions with good pay and little to no physical exertion required on your part  just show up and under-perform daily to eventually move to management where your daily duties are useless synergy meetings  holding the floor down  and keeping your fellow managers company in the furthest possible place from where your employees need you   also  the company throws money at you  the compensation at the dc starts at $17+ for most positions  and you get bumped to $22/hr within the first year  the health insurance is okay if you have the $2750 to spend on medical expenses before they ll help you in any way  they pay for online college classes  which is also cool
Negative_Review: if you work hard and meet your production goals  they'll just up the goals until its physically impossible to meet them  then write you up every week until you cant transfer to a different position and hold you there until you quit because they're allergic to giving you the sweet release of being promoted to customer  also  if your department is under staffed  get used to it because you won't see a new hire for at least a year and only after everyone quits from being overworked because management gets bonuses for keeping labor costs low

Negative_Review: managers never know what they are doing  very hard to talk too  have a little to much power would prefer to write you up then help (trust the open door process most time the help you need is outside of the dc

Title: "Not enough people"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: -pay is very good (started at $11 50/hr) -people i work/worked with are good -atmosphere is generally great -managers are friendly and helpful
Negative_Review: workload can be an overburden at times (most nights there are 4 pallets and could be up to 7 on wednesday for just two people)  newcomers continually leaving  very few people (on my team we have 8 total and 10 if you include managers/assist  managers) *only about 4 of us are stocking  the other 4 6 are mod team   not enough equipment to get work done *as of 9/6/2020 my store is having a remodel done and there are times where dairy and frozen foods don't have a pallet jack to use   schedules can be a pain  overall  if you don't mind heavy workloads from time to time and can be consistently fast paced with your work output then this job seems worth it  the benefits for walmart after the 90 day temp requirement are pretty good  however  keep in mind about the hours they offer you because it will be very difficult to change it later on

Title: "An okay job"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: easy work  decent pay  consistent schedule  easy to relocate/change stores  if the store has good management  you likely won t have much to complain about
Negative_Review: management can be a hit or miss  the first store i worked at the managers were pretty great overall  i moved across the state and the management at the new store was extremely poor  the store was always understaffed  and just about every month the managers would get chewed out by corporate whenever they visited and would have their jobs threatened  so then some of the managers/supervisors would take their frustration out on the associates (we would be threatened with writeups/firings on a daily basis  constantly yelled at and put down by supervisors  etc )  they would say that our team was under performing  but would never tell us how  or offer any real  actionable advice  they would just claim that we were too slow and tell us to "just move faster " keep in mind we would consistently only have 3 4 associates to put up anywhere between 12 20+ pallets of stock (each pallet usually 6 8ft tall)

Title: "Great job with possibilities"

Title: "Good starting job to have!"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: - friendly and very helpful staff  most customers were friendly as well   - could have a different food bar after x number of days of no injuries  food we got then was pretty good too   - ability to work plenty of hours   - i feel like $11 per hour was decent for a starter job  working here 3+ years definitely helped me get through college   - flexible schedules  i was able to work mostly 9 am - 6 pm schedules  which made each week s schedule easier to memorize   - could request time off  which was almost always approved  never missed the summer air show or the chance to visit my aging grandparents during my time here   - decent amount of work to do  varies by dept  but mine (toys) was generally busy   - occasionally helping out other departments also helped diversify the work i did   - long one hour lunch break   - we had a nintendo switch in our break room  didn t use it much  but it was a fun alternative to browsing my phone during breaks
Negative_Review: some days the work was repetitive and days were slow     the occasional rude or prank call customer  just need to move on and go about your day like any other retail job  but still was an annoyance when it happened     could not request time off on holidays  had to plan family gatherings around the job  not a huge problem  but rather a minor annoyance

Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: easy job  decent pay for area
Negative_Review: they don’t give a damn about employees  i literally got fired because i went on break and there wasn’t a cashier in site  i drank my soda and came back inside with the can to pay  and did  3 4 weeks later i was called in and shown the video  i acknowledged it was true but that i paid  they said they knew  but that i had still stolen  i resigned but no charges were ever made and nothing came of it  it was a small town tho and two of the managers spread the rumor not stating the facts  i was both angry and embarrassed  i had never been fired before and haven’t since  as if! who steals a soda but notjng else then carries it back inside and pays and gets fired? smh

Title: "Understaffed"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: benefits opportunities for advancement ability to move departments and diversify experience
Negative_Review: understaffed   neither of the stores i worked at had proper staffing  the one in page had weeks where the finalized schedule was 1 700 hours short of what corporate indicated was needed  attendance   company policy required associates be terminated after receiving 5 points against their attendance (1 per absence  1 for not calling in   5 for a tardy)  some associates had 20+ points  but the store manager liked them or needed them enough to excuse or overlook their points  but would terminate other associates at 5 points  if regular associates were aware of such behaviors  walmart could easily be sued for that  expectations   as a member of management  the expectation was to get the job done despite staffing issues  as a salaried manager  i regularly performed the responsibilities of my associates in an attempt to make up for the missing hours  taking no breaks or lunches to get as much done as possible  despite this  i was yelled at  berated  and called out for doing a poor job in front of other managers and associates

Title: "Toxic Work Enviroment"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: pay is competitive  but not worth the abuse
Negative_Review: stores don't adhere to company culture and constantly break with official company policies  the movie "bad bosses" pretty much used walmart managers as a model for their characters  managers at walmart are unethical  manipulative  and disrespectful  unless the police are involved managers cover up unethical behavior such as rape and sexual harassment within the stores  open door policy only exists to keep things internal  while there is a no retaliation policy  you have to be able to prove it is retaliation  if you invoke the open door you will be retaliated against  what is said in confidence is not kept confident   evaluations are tied to annual raises  so if you're a supervisor management will always find excuses to downgrade your evaluations   promotions are based on management recommendations  so its less about your performance and more about who youre friends with

Negative_Review: employees do not receive any holiday pay  if you work the shift that nobody wants (weekend 12hrs sat mon) you not only lose family gatherings & holiday's but you're only paid for 36hrs not a full 40 like many companies offer because they can't get hard working people to work weekends & when you get forced to work a 10 hr shift during your time off & what management calls 'overtime" those first 8 of 10 hrs working on your day off is straight pay  they don't take into consideration what you gave up to work those straight time hours for the company! the hourly rate does not make up for lost holidays or those 8 hours of straight time pay  there are other companies just down the road who pay just as well & pays double & even triple time   some people have to be with the company for a minimum of 1 year before they can change career preferences unless you're a brown noser  there are others who don't have to wait that 1 year period

Title: "There is more opportunity than you might think"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
authorInfo: Current Employee - Fresh Cap I Associate
Positive_Review: $1 education via guild education (university of florida  ecornell  etc ) aspp (15% extra on stock  up to a limit)  roth and traditional 401k with 100% match up to 6%  aqeduate medical  dental  vision (hsa option)  theoretically  you could get hired homeless and in 2 5 years walk out with 2 years of front line management experience and a 2-year degree and misc certs  oh yeah  and you could be living in another country since its an international company   several matches on charity work and payroll donations
Negative_Review: even with corporate going at breakneck speed to change everything the rollout of good ideas doesn't hit all at once  the communication structure leaves a lot to be desired and on multiple occasions  i have wondered why i can't get paid $30 an hour and work part time with simplified practices (separate pallets by the probability of need  make pallets use   rfid  ble  whatever  to have an instant reckoning of inventory  use wholesaler barcodes for daily const inventory  etc )  the answers are valid but every day millions of productive hours are wasted walking around issues instead of talking through them

Title: "Gain some workforce experience, but not necessarily a positive one"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: it s a decent place to gain some experience in the work force and learn how larger companies operate to some degree  you can learn some valuable customer service skills here  straightforward work most of the time
Negative_Review: even though this is a minimum wage job  it can be quite demanding and fast paced based on the day  when scheduling the employee provides their hours of availability up front  but i was frequently scheduled outside of my hours of availability  and as a college student i cannot be flexible with that! it is frustrating because customers can be exceptionally rude to walmart employees  assuming that because i work there that i must be a stupid person and was occasionally treated with such malice  this last con is picky  but the fluorescent lights can be annoyingly bright and made me dread coming to work if i'm being honest  i learned i don't really like working for large corporations like this one

Positive_Review: flexible hours  departmental mobility  close location
Negative_Review: my area was consistently understaffed and had a high turnover rate among fellow associates and my direct manager

Title: "Pretends they care"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: quarterly bonuses paid time off and sick time after 90 days online call off system
Negative_Review: they do a good job of making it seem like they’re a great company ay from the outside  they offer benefits quickly   give bonuses regularly  and have resources available   but in reality those bonuses cover for the fact walmart only gives a raise if you get promoted  so 10 years on the job as a cashier and your still at minimum wage  plus the company doesn’t really care about you at all  day off requests can be hard to get approved and  people are villanized for calling out  the company has created an environment where customers can do as they please  which means treating employees like they aren’t even people  and you can’t do anything about it   during covid walmart offers bonuses but no hazard pay for employees and waited too long to require customers to wear masks (while employees had been wince march) proving that it’s all about the customer and the employee means absolutely nothing

Title: "Covid 19 cover up,discrimination,sexism,and poor managament"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time
Positive_Review: my fellow automotive techs close to home
Negative_Review: the company has been covering up the fact their workers have covid 19 but have been making them work and anyone who reports not feeling well has been punished not only only that but the company every year steals money and bonuses from its employees and proceeds to pocket it themselves also the there is no security for the employees who have been dealing with the recent shootings and if anyone brings it up is swiftly punished  the store manager is homophobic racist sexist and is not suited for her job i am a gay  mexican citizen who cares for my elderly father and my loved ones kids i raised concerns over the covid 19 and discrimination only for her to make up a lie saying i threatned her after bringing up these issues to her i tried calling human resources but they have sided with the store manager if you have children or anybody you care about stay away!!!

Title: "I worked as both a Bakery and Fashion associate; 5 AM shifts both alone and with people."
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: 1) diverse workforce  if you like your coworkers  it s actually a fun job  2) you learn quick and gain cross-functional consultation skills (customers assume you know the whole store  which you eventually do ) 3) you gain organizational habits!
Negative_Review: 1) overwhelming amount of work  a team that slacks will not meet daily goals  2) high pressure/stress environment  it may seem easy to work at your own pace but customers determine how much you will work that day and management is tough on trivial things (keeping hangers off the floor at all times  keeping tables neat  etc ) 3) without proper management  this job has little incentive

Title: "Not a great place"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: you get an hour lunch which is mandatory
Negative_Review: managers are very demanding  they set insane deadlines and expect you to meet them

Title: "Unrealistic Expectations, Erratic Management"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: - many nights with minimal human contact - good exercise - night shift attracts some colorful characters - the managers  one was fun and laid-back  almost too much  another was reasonable and approachable  listened to her employees
Negative_Review: many nights with minimal human contact   perpetually understaffed  frequently given tasks to complete on my own that needed two or more people to complete withing a reasonable time   the work can be very monotonous   if you do this job long enough you will likely develop physical problems (back problems very common among coworkers who'd been working there 5+ years)   the managers  one had a nervous breakdown and abruptly quit  one loved to scream and humiliate at the slightest provocation  another gave preferential treatment to "the hot girls"   some characters are   too colorful (creepy old perverts  drug addicts/alcoholics  pot stirrers and drama queens)   unpredictable schedules and hours cut (i was given 40 hours + while coworkers were cut down to part time)

Negative_Review: more of a lateral movement type area  hard to move up  positions of leadership are usually held for long periods of time and it's hard to move out of this area into other area's of the company    it is a corporate role  where politics of who you know more then what you know or how you perform play a bigger role in advancement of jobs   risking being laid off at any point during walmart's yearly layoff sweeps   terrible work life balance in hourly roles  including hourly management

Title: "Thought I could handle it (thought wrong)"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: your fellow associates are literally the only pro
Negative_Review: first of all management is terrible  they sit in their office all day and do god knows what what we are all working our butts off on the floor  i went to my am and told her my cousin was getting married in a month  (i’m in the wedding)  and asked if i could have that weekend off  she looked at me dumbfounded and essentially said i would be fired for missing  how far in advance am i supposed to give notice?? a year? i mean it’s ridiculous  also walmart does zero and i mean zero training  expect to be thrown out on the floor with not a single clue of what your supposed to do  if you luck up  one of your associates will teach you all they can  but let’s face it some people are better at training than others  and it’s not their responsibility to train you anyways  i can literally go on and on  this place is trash  avoid it at all cost  i am not a quitter at all but i am here to tell you i’m taking pride in the fact that i’m quitting tomorrow   buh bye wal mart i know you’d dont care that i’m leaving  but man does it feel good!

Title: "Good Easy Job, but there are HUGE ISSUES"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: easy simple job  literally anybody could do it  not joking  they ll hire anyone (heck they hired me)  so just apply  you just say hi to customers and scan any un-bagged item as they leave the store  eat lunch  then go back to do the same thing  then you go home  done deal  not much too complain about other than the two big issues i ll list in the cons
Negative_Review: there are a few things i’d like to share with everyone  first about the impact of wal mart’s employees not following policy  i worked at the county wal mart in st  louis at this address  3270 telegraph rd  st  louis  mo 63125  customers were very entitled  especially old white people  every time i stopped an old white customer they would be surprised that i stopped them  they thought i was accusing them of stealing  i told them this is normal and i have to check everyone  they always would tell me that they've been going there for years and that it was not new  i said yea it's not new it's what they (wal mart) have always been doing    i realized that the customers were being honest when they said they have never been stopped and checked  this made me incredibly sad because it was pretty obvious it was white privilege  i didn't think wal mart had a problem like that  i'm a latino man by the way  i stopped colored people too and most were ready to be checked and knew they had to get ready  i thought they did this because it was normal for all customers to do this  but clearly it was because they were stopped and checked while the white customers and the older white customers were not stopped  this made me incredibly sad    i always did my best to treat everyone equally  what did i get in return? a lot of white customers get angry at me for doing my job  i'm glad i taught them a little bit about equality  but it seemed like i'm the only one trying to treat everyone equally  my co workers were white and didn't seem to notice what they were doing  i even asked them about the old white customers leaving the store without having their un bagged items checked and my co workers just let them leave not stopping to check them  there's something even sadder than that though    the way it works is that you're only stopped if you have items that aren't inside a wal mart bag  like paper towels  soda  big boxes  tvs  and anything not in a bag  the only bagged things that would get scanned are electronics like phones or if somehow you fit a ps4 inside a bag  so basically only un bagged items were scanned and checked  again anything not in a bag means you should be stopped and the item is scanned and so is your receipt     however  i noticed that some customers with items in a bag would take out the item even if it wasn't an electronic and hand it to me to scan  i always told them that i didn't need to check them since it was in a wal mart bag and not an electronic  i realized that they were used to taking out the item and having it scanned when they didn't need to  the people who did that were colored people  it seems like minorities were used to being treated that way while white customers were used to being treated another way  that's white privilege in a nutshell    it was depressing to see this  especially in a city (st  louis) that's already racially divided  wal mart should be working against racial division  not contributing to it  they don't realize they're even doing it  while i am angry with my co workers and wal mart i have to remind myself that white people aren't capable of seeing what their actions result in  they don’t experience the things that we minorities have experienced and continue to experience  wal mart needs to ask and then listen to their customers and employees who are minorities and implement those ideas and suggestions    i worked at ross dress for less just before joining wal mart and even they did better in terms of not racial profiling  i worked as loss prevention at ross  so i should know  i was surprised that wal mart had that sorta issue  but i shouldn’t have been  the ross i worked in was in the city and had many minorities and people of all backgrounds while the wal mart was in the county where mainly white people live  missouri as a whole is mainly white and the major cities have many minorities  but even in the city there is white privilege unfortunately    the second thing that bothered me was their initial response to covid 19  it seemed like good at first  but they were also blind on how ineffective their efforts were  since the customer hosts were near the door we had to clean and disinfect the carts as they came into the building  this was harder and exhausting to do compared to what we were doing before  but i was proud and happy to know that i’m keeping people safe by disinfecting the carts  it felt like i was part of the war effort just like the frontline health workers were    the thing was though  i was the only one disinfecting them properly  i disinfected the carts as they came into the building and made sure that customers never grabbed a cart i didn’t disinfect  i told the customers which ones were disinfected and not to grab the ones i didn’t do yet  this resulted in better interactions with customers  which is important to point out because retail workers are not treated with respect or gratitude in general    my co workers would do the same  at least for a while  then they would stop and just let the customers grab a cart and then disinfect the cart after the customer already touched them  it seemed like common sense was thrown out the window and the customers were needlessly put in danger  i continued to do the proper way to disinfect  which is to clean the handles before a customer touches it  it was hard and exhausting  but i was glad i got to protect my community from a virus that kills    i saw how other retail stores disinfected the carts by spraying the whole cart  at wal mart we only disinfected the handles and i wasn’t fast enough to do that and the whole cart  besides i would need a big sprayer not a little spray bottle to get the whole cart and do it quickly  you had to be fast to ensure no customer grabbed an infected cart and also since there were so many carts coming  i hope that wal mart has done a better job and has those big sprayers that disinfect the whole cart  but they’re still not enforcing facemasks    since i wanted to protect my own family and couldn’t risk getting infected myself i quit my job with wal mart  my family has asthma (including myself) and covid 19 attacks the lungs  it’s almost a death sentence  many customers passed by me and having to disinfect the carts meant a higher chance of catching it  it was a good easy job that paid fairly ($11 50)  but it wasn’t worth putting my family in danger  no job or wage or salary is worth that    i hope that they gain some common sense and also actually follow their own policies in terms of every customer (including white people) have to be stopped if they have an item not in a wal mart bag or is an electronic then have said item scanned and compared to the customer’s receipt  white people  no matter what age  should not be able to get around this policy if other races and ethnicities cannot  enough said  i hope enough is said at least

Title: "Terrible"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: 1 hr lunch and 2 15 min breaks  they supposedly help you pay for college after working for 3 months
Negative_Review: they expect you move giant pallets  unload the pallets  and stock the shelves  then you have zone(make everything look nice)  all of that is fine  but it’s as if they expect you to be superhuman and finish it quickly  they have us stocking multiple areas and zoning other’s areas  i’ve lost count of the amount of times they’ve had us do buggy roundup(cart pushing)  that is not in our job description at all  they expect us to do the jobs of multiple people  for minimal pay to add insult to injury  the people aren’t very nice  i can literally count on two hands the amount of positive interactions i’ve had since starting  they were incredibly rude to someone who had just started   10% discount

Title: "Join only if you do not have any other options"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: it is a big company  if you require visa sponsorship  it will get approved easily
Negative_Review: i have been with this company for more than 2 years now  i work with the membership/marketing team of sams club  when i joined i was relatively less experienced and settled with this job since i had limited options    this company has no values and no work culture  disrespectful behavior is common and you might get shout by senior engineers on daily basis for absolutely no reason  engineers are not qualified and do not have basic skills  senior engineers ask things like teach us java and if you refer them to some tutorial they don't like it  also  among this  it is important to maintain a good relationship with senior engineers  however disrespectful or poor they are at there job  leadership will not take any actions against them  they will get credit for all your good work  most of the design sessions become an insulting game  where everybody is just looking to insult each other  the team has a culture of bullying  harassment  and take advantage of people who are new and not part of their tribe  all things i have said in this paragraph have happened to me and that in front of leadership  i am talking about people at director levels    management (especially at the director level) has no background in tech and completely clueless about software development  last year they brought two tech folks to the leadership role     tech leads can't do basic software design  lack basic programming skills ( forget about ds& algo)  you will never get the credit for the good work you are doing  team culture is toxic  you are dealing with a tribe (this tribe is made of south indian people  they are heavily racist) who is just there to get the work out of you  there is continuous pressure to work on weekends and if you don't then you are not showing responsibility     basically your skill level doesn't matter  your personal relationship has high importance  also how well you fit into the toxic culture of this tribe  it is also important that your skills are poor  people actually do not want strong engineers to grow here since everybody in the team is weak     i have seen people outside of my team also who are surprisingly unprofessional  insult there own teammates or get into shouting games with each other  my experience is mostly within the same club but has worked with sufficient teams in walmart  i am comfortable to say that most of the teams in walmart are like this    if you are wondering  why i just don't switch the job  my h1b got picked up this year  it was my last attempt  i also tried to switch the job last year and cleared technical rounds of some reputed tech companies  they wouldn't continue with me since this was my last attempt for h1b  hopefully  by the end of this year  i will be able to switch and get a job i like

Title: "Irrational and Erratic Management"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: the customers can be great  being able to help them find what they need or design a cake to their specifications and seeing the smile on their faces is very rewarding
Negative_Review: management is erratic and irrational  the expectations for hard working associates is unreasonable while the sycophants whisper in their ears with lies and nonsense and don't have to work  just as long as they fill management's ears with garbage about other employees  talent and hard work is never recognized  you do something you were instructed to do by a supervisor and management doesn't like it  you get written up  you have no defense  they don't even listen to your side  no verbal redirections just straight up written disciplinary actions  you get blindsided by these  hours are cut as retaliation  other associates are fired or forced to transfer and you have to pick up the slack and run yourself ragged trying to keep up but it still not good enough for management  your "productivity" level is measured at unattainable levels and there is no basis for the numbers  meaning it's not in one best way  you get conflicting work assignments which you try to follow and complete but still get in trouble for all while barely making enough to fill your gas tank just to get to work  its not worth it! benefits are terrible  the only insurance is a high deductible health plan and you never meet your deductible because its so high and you are loath to go to the doctor due to having to pay almost a third of your salary just to hit the deductible  corporate employees have it better

Title: "Work in progress"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year

Title: "It was a decent first job, but not a forever job. (for me)"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: + easy going management (at my store) + good interactions with fellow employees (at my store) + ability to easily change jobs as they become available  (there is an internal app system in place where employees can post their job ambitions  there are also training tools available for those wanting to get into management positions ) + while walmart is not unionized  there are certain tools or portals employees can use if they feel wrongfully let go  in my experience this helped other employees on two occasions
Negative_Review: schedule you maximum hours but never enough to qualify for full time   raises happen once a year and are very small  even when scoring in the highest performance review bracket    the employee discount is small  %10 off store items  not including grocery    management is very slow to address concerns or non regular obligations   higher management has no idea how the specialty areas like the photo lab or cell phone department actually operate  this made explaining department needs very difficult

Title: "Think long and hard before joining the company"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: my team  most of my fellow area managers were great  i had a few great mentors  you worked three or four days out of the week  sure  you had to occasionally do some extra duties  like the trailer audits on a day off  but those weren t terrible  you put in a hard eight to ten hours on those days (or 12-14 if you worked the three day sat-sun-mon schedule) but i didn t mind that so much as i had three days off on the weekend  i d get in an hour or so early to set up my shift and stick around an hour or two after to finish off paperwork and other duties  the pay was good and the benefits were great  i constantly swiped my discount card at walmart and scored some deals from time to time  they were very supportive of my reserve schedule  no questions asked  (sure  that s the law  but walmart went out of their way to make sure this was never an issue  i can t say that about all employers ) you ll work long hours some weeks  but that s to be expected in the logistics business  back to school  christmas  and other events means you will get hammered  hours wise  but there are also quiet times as well  january and february don t see much going on out of the ordinary  but be mentally ready for some stretches with long hours  be prepared that you can stroll into work one day expecting it to be a day like any other but due to a power failure  everything has just headed south and it s all hands on deck
Negative_Review: the ops managers will make you or break you  in truth  this can be said of ops managers  agms and gms  if they don't have your back  you are done  my ops manager would write people up first and ask questions later and this led to my demise (as an area manager at least)  while i agree safety is important  walmart takes it to extremes  they demand you go around the warehouse looking for "proactives"  basically  an excuse to write employees up for various safety violations  if i wanted to spend time doing things like this  i'd become a cop  not an area manager  if you didn't do one at minimum once a week  you had management on your case  if any sort of accident happened  and you presented your associate's case to the board  they'd ask you "what level of discipline would you issue in this situation"  this was a loaded question  as you would answer  and present your case  only to find out the ops had his mind made up already and it became a way to attack you for being too lenient (or just to attack you period)  you think they are actually listening to you  but no  (and i dreaded hearing an associate had an accident   not just because i genuinely cared for my people  but because this meant lots of paperwork  meetings  e mails and other interruptions to an already busy day )  there was lots of paperwork and reports to file every night but at least when i was working with the right group of guys we'd divvy it up among ourselves and pound it all out in about an hour  but then  we'd have to high tail it out of there lest our ops come down to visit us with a "good idea" that would see us working there until 5 am if we were on second shift and everything was done by 2 am  finally  though they are good with reserve time  one time i went on my two week tour  and when i came back  i notified hr that i was back at work and ready to start up again  no problems  right? wrong  they didn't pay me for two months afterward  and it took a great deal of work to get the wheels moving on that so i could get paid again as usual  this severely shook the confidence i had in them   another problem lies in whoever the gm is  my first one was very laid back   almost too much  but overall was a good guy  the next one was chock full of ambition to move up  and if his ambition meant driving his area managers into the ground? well  so be it  suddenly the plate that i had just begun to manage fairly well was overflowing with all sorts of additional duties and things we had to do during the week   even  at one point  a mandatory five day week when i was initially scheduled for four  this led to lots of make work items and area managers constantly running into each other  but the gm couldn't have cared any less if he tried  he had his ambitions and that was that    to go back to the headline  if you must work for walmart  do so in a place with a competitive job market  such as a major city or in an area where different employers compete over a limited labor market  if walmart is practically the only game in town  stay far away  the reason is simple  if they are in the former category  you'll have more leverage  and upper management will know this  and treat you accordingly  if the latter  walmart management assumes the attitude of "well  where else are you going to go? we can do whatever we want to you " (even a period of high turnover   which i have seen happen   does little to alter that overall attitude )

Title: "Overall Negative Experience"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: the pay is above average for tech companies  they give okay stock options (long vesting)  there are pockets of the company that do okay work and have smart people
Negative_Review: its an awful environment  leadership is full of people who actually don't care about their associates  they favor a few and give them opportunity while a lot of different teams get shafted    project have arbitrary deadlines  project managers are pretty overbearing while only understanding things at high level  product leadership is almost non existent (most okay product leaders were from jet and jumped ship once stock vested) bentonville counterparts have tons of business roles who do the same thing and call themselves product mangers except dont provide any value    the projects they lead almost never go anywhere    so many re orgs and people leaving every year just after bonuses and stock vesting tell you a lot of about the company  its just a paycheck  if you want good tech experience do not go here  its genuinely awful and if you ask former employees from the tech office about the company as a whole they would probably say its bad  engineers are overworked  some are pretty difficult to work with

Title: "If you have a strong work ethic, then you will go far in this company!"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: -employee discounts -flexible scheduling (if you are a student  then this is a great job for you) -hard work is noticed (just because they do not say anything does not mean they do not notice - it is hard to watch your every move when management is helping out in other departments) -health insurance is good from what i hear -helpful coworkers -management is great (alex and amanda in ogp know how to run an efficient department) -pay is great for the area
Negative_Review: be ready to work (lazy people need not apply)  clueless employees (most people do not have a clue what is going on nor are they willing to try and find out)  disciplinary action is non existent  employees complain about things they cannot change instead of controlling their reactions and doing what they can to get their work done  employees overstep their boundaries (here's an idea  let management manage and you work  if you have a problem with the way something is done  talk to your boss privately   this is why they have an open door policy   and then get back to work)  leadership amongst frontline employees is non existent (management cannot possibly be there for every waking moment  so some of y'all need to step up your game and be the change you want to see in the world)  some employees (not all) lack integrity  this company thrives on initiative (like i said  if you do not want to work and earn your paycheck  then you should not apply here)  training is basic and not useful  unreliable employees (some people have a bad habit of calling in sick too much   i am guilty of this too)

Title: "What I experienced"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 10 years
Positive_Review: alright benefits  good people to work with  constant workflow  always stay busy  assistant pay is much better
Negative_Review: work all holidays except christmas  not much of home life  policy changes constantly  favoritism is a problem in management  the store manager does not evaluate correctly on sales performance  the store manager is told by hr what percentages they must have on associates evaluations causing some unjust evals  store managers evaluate by only what they see in a brief walk by  not one time has a store manager gone out to help in the autocare center with tires or oil changes  days off are not consecutive mostly split so you have one day off then its back to work  the home office will not come out and say they are eliminating assistant manager roles  instead  they tell store managers that if an assistant has had a coaching offense within the last year then that assistant must be terminated  although  this is the first time in my 22yrs that they forgo the actual policy of coachings  the assistants are never replaced

Title: "Awful Treatment of Employees"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: paid time off accrual is pretty quick if you work enough hours  paid and unpaid requests off are usually approved  assuming first-come-first-serve and there isn t anything important for the company going on  and they feel like you deserve it   laxer on attendance than most other low-tier chains if you re sick or have an emergency * you ll learn a lot  you will meet good people  although few
Negative_Review: you're punished if you choose not to work overtime or come in when called 100% of the time  you're given unfavorable hours  no matter how good you do you'll only hear about the one thing you didn't do  you will work 6 days in a row  get one day off  and work another 5  all while mysteriously staying under 40 hours a week somehow  you will work nights  you will work overnights  you will work on holidays  without holiday pay  you will have no life what so ever  make no noise about your unhappiness with your manager's performance  as you'll only become even more of a target for harassment  the amount of money paid is not enough to cover the amount of emotional trauma you'll receive from customers and your own team  and be expected to smile through it   you're paid to smile  after all  the company as a whole is an extremely toxic environment where management can do no wrong  you're nothing but a replaceable drone  and you're treated as such  extreme "us  vs  them" mentality amongst the employees

Negative_Review: treatment of customers and workers  bad hygiene of the workplace  and most managers contradicting each other  a lot of this is problems with being understaffed and people not caring about customer safety  customers walk out of the store because something only a manager or someone with a license of some sort can help them and they wait for a long time  i hate it because i wanted to help them but i am not allowed to  the old store management was a bit better though  i think once all/most of the managers were on lunch  i was a cart attendant and then because of a temporary injury i was moved to making sure the shelves were stocked

Title: "Negative Reinforcement"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: the company has lots of incentives and benefits after you complete your first 90 days  concerns with payroll  etc are usually addressed quickly  best breakroom i ve seen in any company  like a mini convenient store
Negative_Review: performance management is based heavily on negative reinforcement  employees are frequently threatened with disciplinary action in group settings  almost anything can get you a write up and its delivered to you right in the workplace amongst your fellow employees while you're working  the biggest problem with this is that the training is almost non existent  you may get a coupke of hours with a trainer when you start  then after that  you're on your own  the repetitive disciplinary actions for minor offenses that you have not even been made aware of is demoralizing and causes a hostile workplace  the employees are not happy  the company offers a higher bonus if you dont get "occurences" or disciplinary actions  makes me wonder if thats why they are given out so liberally  also  because of previous theft  everyone is treated as if they're going to steal something  to that i say  stop employing people that background says  "i steal"

Positive_Review: flexible scheduling  learning community pharmacy operations  numerous patient interactions and opportunities for gaining counseling experience
Negative_Review: some duties such as medication verification are restricted  some travel is required depending on location  pay is below other competitors  and stores are consistently short staffed weekly

Title: "Great company to work for"

Title: "Great experience initially but tough to grow"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: - as a cta you work very closely to the merchants and learn a lot of how to successfully manage a category   - you gain exposure to various cross functional teams such as marketing  planning and ecommerce - lots of learning programs available for you to develop your skills
Negative_Review: it is extremely hard to grow from a cta role  preference is given to the dare program associates  better to get into dare program as they are given better opportunities within categories   very rare to move up from the cta role to an associate category manager role or move up in general (higher success rate of moving to an entire different team  which is still rare)  it is very evident that ctas don't get to first round of interviews when looking to apply internally

Negative_Review: so  so many  management contradicts themselves consistently  instructing you to do one thing  then basically writing you up for doing it  they pull you for reprimand on completely bs terms  and 99% of the time  don't explain what you did wrong  so you can't improve as a person or an associate  they will consistently have you work second shift  then open next morning

Title: "-10/10 Do not recommend"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: you get to see a lot of cute animals come through  you ll make some friends  you ll get some basic skills  a decent first job if you really can t get anything else  starting pay is $11 an hour for most jobs  some of the managers care
Negative_Review: where do i start? the customers  the floors are terrible to stand on  the mats they give don't help at all  a lot of the things people come through with are expired or moldy  insurance is useless  most of the managers don't care  some of the employees don't care and will just walk off and no one can find them  the hours are a nightmare  they will often ask you to work full time hours but still classify you as part time  so they don't have to give you full time benefits
