Title: "Its alright."
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: super flexible schedule  you get pto and even ppto  compensation is fair enough whenever you re doing your normal duties
Negative_Review: you are expected to work throughout the entire store  even though i am electronics i have pushed carts  moved mulch in lawn and garden and stocked dairy  the worst part about that isn't that its hard  it's that nobody genuinely appreciates your help and working hard is never celebrated at walmart  if you did the bare minimum every day and mere just showed up you would make just as much money as your co worker who works 5× harder  i don't want this section to be too long so i'll leave it at that  but plenty more to complain about

Title: "Does Not Care About Employee"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: co-workers are very friendly and most customers are a pleasure to serve
Negative_Review: supervisors don't really care about their employees  they are overworked also  so much is expected of them and they just pass it right on down the line  there were quite a few times when they forgot to give me my break and when i finally found someone to ask they would doubt my word about having no break  highly insulting  they don't treat you as an individual and no matter if you give 10% or 110% you are treated the same way  so  if you are a conscientious and great employee it doesn't benefit you whatsoever  in fact  they take advantage of that and expect you to pick up the slack of the people who don't want to do the job

Title: "A lot has change in last 2 years to be worst for employees"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: good benefits for salaried members compared to other chains  you get a lunch (if you are lucky you get full 30 min if not pharmacy not busy  pharmacists are expected to open the gates and help the patients when they are on lunch)   even if the company has a policy on 2 -15 min break it is not implemented for pharmacist since there no cover and there is more than enough technician and pharmacist work to handle  lot of expectations from upper management to work from home on your days off for managers to roll out silly initiatives which has nothing do with prescriptions   patient health
Negative_Review: since you are salaried lot of unpaid work that your supervisor expect you to do  in last 2 years  lot of changes have happened since the pharmacist and technicians layoff happened  hours have changed to one pharmacist per store per day  you would be luck if you get a full 30min lunch even if you are entitled to it  you are expected to find your cover for shifts event if there are plenty of schedulers for region (and congrats you laid of 1/3rd of rphs just this year)  no scope to move up in shrinking workforce   walmart wellness days are joke  lot of unpaid work for managers in tabling events! no proper insurance contracts in place   and you are expected to get more prescription quotas every year  the performance reviews has changed to be less favorable to employee  raises have been slashed to les than half  system updates are the worst  lot of failures/botched roll outs in last 2 3 years  not enough room to give feedback to it/upper management on technology issues

Title: "Walmart is ... interesting"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: there are always higher positions to move into   they ve been reasonably good about corona  starting march and going through at least june  we ve received $300/month bonuses  they also implemented a no-questions-asked two week paid leave for anyone who shows corona symptoms   the basic tasks required of you are easy  the quantity  not so much   10% discount on non-grocery items all year  10% off everything from thanksgiving through new years  and 25% off one transaction in early december if you work all scheduled shifts on black friday weekend
Negative_Review: the store only closes for 36 hours on christmas day  you will work every other holiday   if you tell a customer no for any reason  be prepared for management to give them what they want anyway   the average customer at walmart gets away with things that nobody would ever dream of trying at any other retail establishment  leaving frozen goods out on shelves  sticking wads of gum to cardboard srps  spilling product and simply walking away  there's also a reason there is a "people of walmart" site and not a "people of target" or "people of jewel "  walmarts have exactly two kinds of employees  the people who do everything and the people who give zero craps  usually it's the young kids and 20+ lifers who capped out their raises years ago that fall under the latter category   your attendance points have the ability to take away a lot of benefits  if you have many demerit points but not enough to be terminated for attendance  you can lose quarterly profit sharing bonuses and your yearly raise   on the subject of yearly raises  the non supervisory positions get a flat 2% per year as long as they're breathing and do not have too many attendance points  supervisory positions can get nothing  2%  or 4%  it has been admitted on several occasions that management is required to grade their supervisors on a curve  and only one or two people in a facility will get that 4% if they win the popularity contest   there are always a ton of supervisory positions to move up into with pay bumps ranging from 1 to 3 dollars  but the reason these are always available is because it takes less than a year for the person to realize they've made a horrible mistake and to leave the position  making the downward step loses 5% to 10% of your current pay depending on how far back down the ladder you go    home office is always busy concocting some new way to be a nuisance  for instance  the "lose your yearly pay raise" i mentioned in the last paragraph was announced to the employees 30 days after the cutoff date where they evaluated your attendance points in consideration for your raise  i was lucky and had none at the time  but a heads up would have been great given that people would cash in all of their sick time to remove those points beforehand  they also have an insane notion of truck to shelf  and their method of making this work is annoying the bejesus out of their morning workers by making the auditing system pull far too much product out of the backroom to make the employee shlep it out to the floor  find out none of it fits  then shlep it right back to put it back in   equipment is always impossible to find or barely working  walmart's response to this problem is releasing an android and ios app that lets employees access work apps through their personal devices  these apps make fundamental changes to your phone in the name of "security"  like making you change your pattern/pin every couple months or disabling biometrics

Title: "Management only cares about their Proftshare"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for less than a year

Title: "Not much to expect"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: flexible scheduling  great people  great times
Negative_Review: one of the lowest paid jobs in the stores  but one of the most important ones  the entire store depends on there being carts for people when they are going to go shopping  so you will be scrambling to get enough carts in when it's busy  this is even more true when you're scheduled by yourself    they constantly change systems  such as scheduling  and they almost constantly go down  want to check when you're scheduled? too bad  the app/site is down  this was constant  you would always need to update their app  and then have it not even work for a week    one final thing was the system with time off  there are things that are supposed to protect you when you can't call in  this is called protected paid time off  and you can use it to cover the time when you weren't able to make it to work  however  there was a flaw in which the system wouldn't recognize that you had used paid time off  and treat that time in which you were gone as if you had done a no call/no show

Title: "Not what it used to be"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 8 years
Positive_Review: good learning experience due to the company’s extreme size & scale   nice southern people  work tends to be trivial at most director levels & below due to excessive head count and unlimited resources) but extremely political due to the absurd amount of unused talent and terrified competent associates trying to survive yearly layoffs (rifs) at all levels  people who are extremely good managing up at vp and above levels could thrive temporarily with some luck
Negative_Review: the company is going through a massive and damaging culture shift  due to leadership’s obsession to become like “amazon”   sadly  the company in general is too bureaucratic  disorganized and conservative to even get close one day   sr  leaders appear completely disconnected  they don’t make the least effort to know or interact with their teams anymore (sometimes not even with their direct reports) and all they will give are canned messages (bs) with no relevant content   this is not the place to make any kind of true difference or build a well planned career  the place is already too crowded with unused talent and there are just too many bad habits   most projects are based on  a “go and help in whatever you can” mindset  sadly most teams would of course shut you down or steal your credit due to politics and lack of role clarity   vp’s and sr  directors  will literally get offended if you push for clarity on your team’s kpi’s   never do this  just go with the flow and become good at pretending you are doing great work as everyone else     after nearly nine years and several promotions i left by my own foot  heartbroken to see what my once great walmart had become

Title: "Too demanding very little pay"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: -they offer quarterly bonuses   -for the most part it s a great place to grow     -used to have free donuts on fridays
Negative_Review: for the bonuses you'll have to wait some time before you actually qualify to get any    you can grow with the company if you can survive the many employees that think they don't have to work because they have been with the company for the past 15 years   many supervisors and workers constantly on the phone  either talking or watching videos    management is either really incompetent or just try to look the other way instead of dealing with the bunch of associates that just show up to collect a paycheck   the rules are in the books but nobody bothers to follow policy   never work too hard or they will demand more and more from you every day    in a department of 5 people  maybe two of them will be actually working  the rest will be talking   nobody really cares about quality   you never know how you will be treated  because it is going to exclusively depend on the mood of your supervisor/department manager   you will get a schedule that will rarely ever resembles what you agreed to work   they will hire you part time to avoid giving you benefits but would constantly schedule you 40 hrs a week "because they need you"

Title: "Not Worth a Full Star, if desperate for a job"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: a few nice co-workers and some polite customers
Negative_Review: 1  cleaning up after messy customers  especially when they leave partially eaten food on the folded clothing on display  2  there is no confidentiality when you report a concern to the ethics  manager will call you in for a talk  reading what you emailed to ethics  3  workplace bullying (by some seniors)  4  must come into store to check work schedules  if you are hired as flex you could go a month or more of not working  5  being told by department manager that there are no hours because of budget cuts  yet when you give the manager a choice of lay off or hours  a miracle of being 'penned' into a schedule  6  not working for a while apply for ei  however the office person tells ei that hours were refused  7  covid19  ( when i was in store) no distancing  no masks provided  walmart put money into hiring more staff in place of keeping their regular staff safe  8  having to repeat your hours of availability at least 10 x  the office has the formal document of hours of availability

Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: there is decent pay  hour lunch
Negative_Review: managers aren't very nice to the workers  they're more like drill sargents on second shift  switch your positions every day to something else  you can't learn one before switching so fast  then they expect you to know it  can't ever get any help with schedule issues from the app  they don't really understand when your really sick you only get 5 misses before you're terminated  they don't understand if you have kids even though they say they do in the beginning  they cut your hours as soon as you have been there a couple months to two days a week  half of management is on drugs on 2nd shift that i know of  they don't even drug test like they say they do  very loose place to work for  for the money  it doesn't pay that much to me to deal with all of the stuff  never got my discount card

Title: "Disorganized"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 8 years
Positive_Review: walmart promotes within  if you re good at looking like you do a good job  and getting face-time with the higher ups  you ll get promoted
Negative_Review: being in grocery floor/frontline operations is a disorganized mess (in my dc)  ops management will jump from focus to focus in the name of "adaptability" or "managerial agility " but they're doing it to cover up their lack of organization  mention that they're disorganized and not giving clear guidance or leadership and you're lacking "a sense of urgency" or "time management" on your next review   speaking to that  the area manager role is not defined well at all  you have hr and admin work for numerous direct reports (i've had up to 80)  shift planning  protections  and shift management  they're also moving to give area managers analysis projects too  basically they'll get every ounce of work they can and then ask you to come in an extra day  60 hour work weeks are typical (even on the three day a week schedule)

Title: "Great pay accompanied by horrible management and a total lack of consideration for associates training , or wellbeing."
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: the pay is good enough to live comfortably with a single income ( distribution /warehouse specifically) i rated 3 stars based solely on the pay rate if i were to rate them based on anything else it wouldn t have even been that high
Negative_Review: outdated equipment for such rediculous production numbers  lack of interest in properly equipping associates to properly to do they're job while still constantly increasing production  lack of interest in associates overall well being (for example putting production numbers as priority over safety concerns such as product shipments that requires two person or team lifting left to a single person to do it alone and still expects them to meet production ) for the number one retailer in the world you would be shocked by how old the production equipment is there were entire sections that were not even in service for various reasons and yet they still continue to up production also on days with low freight deliveries they still hold the associate accountable for not hitting production they have a huge turnover rate and high pay in the distribution area for a reason associates are considered disposable and treated as so

Title: "Distribution Center Order Filler (Meat and Produce)"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: - pay is good compared to similar jobs with no experience required - great job if you are young or single  - incentive to earn up to +30% of your base pay based on performance -all the schedules have at least one weekend day off  -lunch break is paid  -production goals are realistic and even if you cannot maximize your incentive  there should be no issues meeting productivity goals after 3-4 months if you are not slacking   - you will be in pretty good shape if you eat healthy
Negative_Review: schedule really sucks  never a consistent time leaving  shifts are supposed to be 10 or 12 hours  but you really never know    long shifts will be spent constantly lifting things  you will get used to it    every second of your shift is timed and tracked   breaks are short  20 minute lunch break  but that includes the time it takes you to get to and from the break room in a large warehouse  realistically your break will be between 10 and 15 minutes to eat and use the restroom  you can still use the restroom during your shift  but the time will negatively impact your production  which brings your incentive pay down

Title: "“Great Workplace”"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: ive only worked at walmart for almost 3 years and i’ve loved every minute of it! i started off just wanting to pick up a couple shifts a week for extra christmas money for my family as my second job it didn’t take me long to realize i really to part of this company and make a career of it! i love walmart’s standards and benefits and the environment i get to work in everyday! my store was chosen to be one of the great workplaces everyone in the store was nervous about the changes and my store manager kept telling us things were going to be ok  i think the hpc ( high performance culture) is exactly what every store needs we need everyone performing to their best to keep customers happy and of course to keep our everyday low price guarantee! i know walmart has changed my life with giving me the opportunity  to make great wages and now only work one job and one job that i love going to work everyday i walk in  walmart isn’t just a job it is family and i’m so proud to be part of that family!
Negative_Review: i have no cons with working for walmart i’m glad it’s going in the direction it is and having the hpc we need to make sure we have everyone performing at the same level and make sure are customers are being took care of at the standard the sam walton set the bar at!

Title: "Worst Management and Company Culture you can Imagine"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: pay and benefits are decent
Negative_Review: operation managers are corrupt hr is biased most new upper management are from amazon and only care about numbers and productivity while leaving associate engagement and lower level management on the backburner  they punish lower management for their own shortcomings    upper management articulate their strategies as nothing more than a set of bold bullet point statements such as "innovate to win" or leverage best in class talent " they don't even bother loosely linking their "projects" to the long term vision or mission statement  i'm not even sure they even know what the mission statement is   upper management constantly yells and belittles lower management about how poorly they perform  but don't give constructive feedback or any sort of plan of action  they threaten to punish and to hold them accountable for the reason being that "they don't want to be on another call to explain why we didn't hit plan again"  what kind of leader does that?       mid to upper management show blatant favoritism and then fire or move other management in order to suit their needs or to have their buddies with them on the same shift  a lot of under the table dealings are done as well  the whole building that i worked at is falling apart from the inside out and not even the ethics department is doing anything about it  no one wants to work there and it's the worst revolving door organization that i have ever worked at

Title: "It was better five years ago than it is now, and it's better now than it will be five  years from now"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 8 years
Positive_Review: education benefits  good 401k plan  possibility of a good quarterly bonus  room for growth and advancement
Negative_Review: no holiday pay   just additional disciplinary action if you fail to work scheduled holidays    constant over hiring to prevent any associate from getting enough hours to live on   quarterly bonus usually pitiful because corporate keeps adding things to it to make it harder to obtain the full amount   senior management is focused on the numbers and could not care less about the people who make those numbers happen   new policies and procedures being introduced now were clearly developed by people who have neither done the jobs nor sought input from those who do   managers make less per hour than their hourly associates once you factor in all the extra time that managers are expected to spend in the building   constant increases in expectations and responsibilities without a commensurate increase in wages   raises are not large enough to keep pace with the cost of living

Negative_Review: the managers  from the csms to the asms  will either slave you and forget that you're a human being that needs to focus on one thing at a time to truly do a great job or yell and belittle you constantly because they have an attitude problem that was never resolved in their youth  do not even think about complaining to certain managers about how certain employees are doing or even other managers because even if the complaints are legitimate and grounded in evidence  if they're good friends with those people  they will either disregard it and not care about your report or threaten to terminate you for wasting their time about another employee or manager

Title: "Save your sanity, Live better, Don't Work at Walmart"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: honestly  i can t think of any at all  well  okay  the co-workers i met briefly on my first day seemed pretty cool  but walmart is trash
Negative_Review: everything is wrong here  i was hired as a personal shopper yet in the orientation i was told we would be placed wherever we are needed  i don't mind learning new things but don't throw us into everything on the first day  we spent 4 hours watching the stupidest videos that had nothing at all to do with our jobs and then they threw us out onto the floor and into the deep end  a group of three  myself included  helped out with frozen and dairy  we didn't know how to use a scanner  we didn't know how to figure out where to stock things  yet we were expected to just jump in and do it  i was also hired as part time but i was scheduled from week one at 40 hours per week  walmart can consider you part time for as long as they want without having to give you benefits  they do this so that they can avoid giving you benefits for a year  yes  if you're part time you don't get it for a year even if you are working full time hours  all of this so the walton's can earn $70 000 per minute  while we earn $20 000 a year  what a joke    in my interview i specifically asked if i'd be given the proper training and not thrown into the deep end  well  i wasn't given the proper training at all  same day as orientation  they just threw us all on the sales floor with zero preparation except for some helpful tips of how to lift from the "green zone" so as not to hurt your back    i finished my first day  left my vest and badge on my manager's desk  and said deuces  what a joke  avoid  avoid  avoid if possible unless you are literally going to be homeless    oh  they also had us working in the freezer and dairy without jackets    finally  my hours were jacked around after they were set  walmart also has zero standards  my interview was a joke  the assistant manager  who i didn't like from the beginning  was snooty about my notebook and pen (for taking notes and asking questions)  he asked me if i was doing homework  no dummy  i'm preparing for an interview professionally and actually showing that i care enough to prepare  moron  they gave me a mini tour of the store and then i was literally offered the job  this was after waiting 30 minutes past my scheduled interview time to be seen  didn't even care about that either  they are so fundamentally unorganzied i don't know how they even function day to day  so yes  they offered me the job without any questions except to ask my availability and if i was okay to work weekends  so they will literally just hire anyone who is desperate enough to do any job

Title: "Feedback is a gift"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: great team and partnerships with directs and cross functional teams   i had a wonderful opportunity here with access to great teams and support   i was given the autonomy to create programs and the ability to navigate and bring in benchmark practices to my function   my team was wonderful and the people really do make that difference   i love this company and i am constantly cheering on the sidelines  they do great things!
Negative_Review: unfortunately  the last year i was reorganized under home office management and that team was not supportive and very secretive at times   they did not share information  did not share things so that i could have information to do my job and did not want to listen to information on best practices or how to benchmark data    the incompetence level was high and known by people but nothing was ever done

Title: "Decent Job"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: always 40 hours  great people  great perks- especially the college program  the team like atmosphere makes the work go by and enjoyable  the busy atmosphere is a good workout!
Negative_Review: crazy workload overnight at times unrealistic expectations for the limited staff  i was literally expected to do 17 hours of freight alone and be finished most nights  light nights were 8 11 hours of work in my 8 hour shift   i had a stalker customer that was allowed to follow me around and ask me for my number knowing i'm married over and over  watching me bend over stocking shelves making comments  it was awful  he was only asked by management to "move on" from my location one of the several times he came in  not even to leave the store  i am quitting because the last straw was him waiting in the parking lot two days ago at 7am when i got off work and he was last in the store around 2am  my availability has been messed up for four months and even with bringing it up over and over it has repeatedly not been fixed and i've been forced to use protected pto to take the days i can't work off

Title: "One of the WORST Jobs, Just Work Elsewhere!"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: cross-training  sometimes flexible scheduling  kind coworkers  some good lower management  slightly consistent daily tasks
Negative_Review: unprofessional and verbally abusive management  unrealistic expectations  constant and unresolved drama  absent management  even more absent upper management

Title: "Poor Work Life Balance"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: pay isn t bad but not worth the hours put in   vacation and sick leave is nice to have if you can ever take it because they can t keep their management staff
Negative_Review: you will work sometimes 50 plus hours a week and your salary is calculated at 45 hours a week   it's hard to keep the stocking team motivated and the turnover is horrible so you have to keep replacing people   comanagers like to let the asms do all the work while they sit in the office   store manager is gone more than he is at the store and even when he is there he's out the door around 5pm  walmart's open door policy is broken   market level won't tack action against a store manager if he or she is turning a profit unless its something illegal or harassment

Title: "Living nightmare doesn't describe it"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than 8 years
Positive_Review: a few nice people did work there at one point
Negative_Review: a few years after i started  the company took away all benefits from part time employees and made it nearly impossible for anyone to become full time  after a well publicized pay raise to $11 an hour  the store only gave 2% raises every year after that  they threaten to fire people for not being able to come in during dangerous weather conditions  about five months before i quit  my job position was changed without my permission  i went from running a register and dealing with one customer/family at a time to having to monitor seven self check out registers for up to nine hours a day  when anyone else was placed in this area  they were allowed to share the workload with one or two other people  whenever i showed up to work the scan and go area  whoever was in charge of the front always made the other employees leave just to place me in the uncomfortable position of running the entire area by myself  i had no say in the matter and was repeated screamed at by one member of management when i could not keep up with seven monitors plus try to keep shoplifters from going out the door  no one else had this done to them but me   another member of management made personal attacks on my family  demanding to know how we had any money at all to ever go on vacation (which was not their business)  one member of management made my life and my family's life such a living nightmare that my doctor wanted to put my on disability for the severe anxiety and mental abuse this person inflicted on me  when a member of my family phoned corporate about this person  the company thanked us by promoting them  almost everyone i knew quit or took their retirement because of this one employee (and anyone who comes into the store or lives in the city knows who this is)

Title: "Not worth the long run"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart part-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: you get paid well  the work isn t too intense once you ve started working
Negative_Review: everything  management expect you to do more for the store you work in  work in multiple areas  even areas that you weren't trained in  tons of pressure to anyone from both customers and management  when they say they'll take everything in consideration for ones well being  but they mean you have to be an assistant manager or higher for any perks  there is no reward at the end  myshare is a scam for part timers  you work like 32 hours  5 days a week  three months later  you're only get 1 day off of cumulative hours you worked you can use for a sick day  not only that  you have to avoid getting absent for three month for a bonus  doctors notes or family emergency will count to your absences

Title: "Walmart should get out of pharmacy completely"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart
Positive_Review: -coworkers  if they re not the drama sorts -401k match  downside is  you have to be there for 1 yr
Negative_Review: worst retail pharmacy job i ever took  grass isn't greener on the other side  and this was definitely that    a  technology is cumbersome and inefficient  help desk is nonexistent when problems arise which leads me to think like everything else walmart   they understaff  cut corners and dont care about their workers  b  pay is mediocre  mileage is better than other chains  but they use "flexors" instead of per diems to avoid paying travel time   c  no employee loyalty  i witnessed the purge of 2019  and questioned whether some of it was even ethical/legal  d  understaffing  our pharmacist overlaps were drastically reduced and yet we were expected to perform at the same level before if not better  pretty clear to me that the company sets up their own employees to fail so that they do not need to pay out bonuses

Title: "A company that doesn't care"

Title: "*What they will NOT tell you.*"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: honestly it s not that many pros about the company from an associate level   well they do pay you a check  but it s just enough to get by until the next check
Negative_Review: plenty! if you are accustomed to a company with a standard set of polices  this is not that place   the rules are constantly changing  and the associates are not informed until it's too late  the break schedule is a disgrace   shift length 10hrs= 1 20min & 1 15min break  12hrs= 2 20min breaks  we are always hungry because we can not finish our lunch/dinner   what type of company does there associates like that? did i mention that we are not allowed to go outside on breaks only  to the smoking area  what if you don't smoke?  meanwhile the managers who are pushing production  get a hour long lunch plus breaks   the schedule is subject to change   this is not something that will be told to you during the hiring process  so if you have other life plans  don't   walmart is really great at giving people chances at positions that they are not qualified for   this simply means that they have many managers that are first time managers and their interpersonal skills suck  on the up side there is room to grow with the company   i have been with the company 5yrs and it's had it's up but the downs defiantly out way

Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for less than a year

Title: "A mostly great job"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: -the minimum pay for all retail positions in the store is higher than what you’re going to find at any other retail or service job in most areas    -the work is typically easy  but repetitive  which should be expected since walmart is a retail bureaucracy   -paid 15 minute breaks every 2 hours and a generous hour lunch that is unpaid    -in this specific position  customer hosts prevent theft by checking receipts and reporting suspicious activity or potential push outs to higher authorities such as salaried management  customer service managers  or asset protection associates  depending on if you enjoy preventing theft or working in a criminal justice related position (to an extent)  this could be a pro or con for you    -most people and customers at this specific store are kind  but this can change from store to store
Negative_Review: standing for long periods of time  endlessly greeting customers and checking receipts for unbagged  larger items    most customers hate you and see you asking for receipts as a personal vendetta rather than a job you have to do based on what’s sitting out in their cart  this can lead to potentially violent situations if hosts aren’t careful with how they address customers     many customers who believe they are educated on your position more than you will claim that it is illegal to ask for their receipt  this is not true  as it is not illegal to ask someone a question  instead  it is illegal for a customer host to detain customers who refuse to show receipts  but most hosts are taught that this action is not allowed     people see you as personal electric scooter assistant  who can magically make a fully charged scooter appear  many customers who “need” a scooter are extremely rude and refuse to treat you as a human being     management is hit or miss  managers are either very kind and understanding  or very rude  demanding  and self centered     depending on your department  certain managers are not flexible with hours and will not follow your schedule or fix your schedule if the computer schedules you incorrectly

Title: "They pay you but the work environment is cancer"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: they do pay you profit share if you qualify to receive it
Negative_Review: i worked at various stores from 2012 2019  and they're all the same  the management is out to get you and relies on fear tactics to keep employees in line   they're really good at giving you ridiculous hours all over the place to make it impossible to get a second job or even think about applying for a new job  if you're in school and your availability has to be less  they make it your fault  on more than one occasion i'd been written up for completely ridiculous things (ie  using my phone to help a customer or being 3 minutes late) and ended up having a literal panic attack in the office in front of the two managers who were writing me up  they just insisted that i sign the paper (which will go against you when it comes time for your review/raise) and then get back to work

Title: "My experience at Walmart was exciting, educational, socially enlightening, and inspiring."
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart
Positive_Review: it’s a steady paycheck and there are lots of benefits  your co-workers are friendly and (mostly) nice and very helpful  you can talk to the managers  all the way to the top! and they actually listen! my favorite part of the job was giving customer service  i guess i was pretty good at it
Negative_Review: sometimes we were very short handed and had to cover the whole store  some days we had difficult or even abusive customers  none of us enjoyed that  the hardest part was christmas and black friday  it took weeks to get the store back in shape because of the mess people made  i got really tired of repairing torn packages and folding clothes!

Title: "It's demanding, hectic, and you really need to drive yourself intrinsically"

Negative_Review: strong disconnect between corporate policy and actual work procedures heavy workload awful radio self plugs poorly planned out store layout (produce backroom far from actual sales floor and have to push through stockroom) puts profit and growth ahead of customers and workers little opportunity for raises within given work position

Title: "The best of brick and mortar retailers."
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than 10 years
Positive_Review: 1  walmart trains their management very good   2  stores are very structured  everything has a process and you always have the information of how to do things at your fingertips    3  compensation  i left walmart to find out that nobody in retail pay equal to walmart (with the exception of amazon)  4  opportunity for advancement  5  technology  i left walmart and found that other retailers are light years behind in technology  light years!!!
Negative_Review: 1  highly political environment  four of our stores were realigned into a new market   one year later all 4 store managers replaced and only 2 of the 10 co managers are still with company  it's not how you preform it's who promoted you and are they still around  2  you put in 80 hours per week for 3 weeks getting ready for regional visit and they don't show  your hourly crew is disappointed because they made the store look great and nobody showed  30 days later they show up on sunday afternoon to rake you over the coals because your store did not look as good as the store they visited last wednesday morning

Negative_Review: no lunch after working 12 hour shifts  managers stay in office all day  fall under 100 percent in production or anything is a step or write up  occurence or all the above  getting the job was worse thing that happened in my life  leaving was best thing happening in my life

Title: "Abysmal and stressful work culture."
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: • helping customers is easy   • shift is a breeze once alone in assigned aisle stocking shelves with pallet
Negative_Review: • no drug testing  some employees reeked of marijuana and behaved as such   • no help beyond the initial computer modules during orientation  this led to unnecessary frustration and being antagonized by others who were already established   • if truck unloading became overwhelming for the team  occasionally management would show up and start yelling with profanity   • ethics hotline is useless as you're redirected to your own store's management which may be part of the problem

Negative_Review: management is horrible at this point  we're have a lot of new faces in management  but the old ones need to go   there are two managers that talk down to people and treat them as if they are less than  one has been in trouble several times  but she's still a manager  why? because walmart doesn't fix their issues

Title: "Fired"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: i loved my job   i felt like we were a strong team   until i was proved wrong
Negative_Review: a co worker moved in with me cause they had no where to go   i quickly learned that the couple were liars and users   i threw them out for not paying rent really for 2 months they didnt pay nothing   i went shopping at my store and i was told that couple had been telling people i drugged them and that i had a gang there with chain and guns throwing them out  which was a total lie   i confronted  the couple and they raised there voice and threw a fit   the male put his hands on me and i told him to get his hands off me   my neighbor who was with me stepped threw the bakery door just to see if i was ok   i decided to walk away and leave cause all he was going to do is get me in trouble   little to my surprise did i get called to the office and fired for it   someone called it in to corporate and lied about what exactly happened   i dont think i d have fired    i want my job back  what so i do ?  did they have the right to fire me

Title: "Use it as a stepping stone only, unless you are souless like them!"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for more than 5 years
Positive_Review: store employees are polite  bonuses  10% discount  education opportunities
Negative_Review: late night hours  working holidays if you're not among the pharmacists favorites  the technician takes the blame and does the majority of work  don't treat the customers polite  it's not professional and takes you too long  if you can take being talked down to by rph  you can handle this job because you will be treated like you are way below them  never enough help  hours cut  if you are desperate for a job in this field work here  otherwise rx packaging is a respectable job    employees that have been with the company 10 years+ have mostly been let go  few remain and are scared  waltons' way is no longer  customers are expected to keep purchasing based on convienence  price and supply  not treatment  worked at different locations in fl  going downhill for years  there is no open door effectiveness  management/rph can threaten/downgrade techs and get away with it  we are the bottom of the hill  it rolls down and you are treated that way  ironically you have to be intelligent and patient to handle the job  yet you don't carry the same degree as rph  so you are less and made aware of it  just know if you decide to work here  you won't be happy

Title: "Few positive aspects"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart
Positive_Review: large category specialist classes of recent undergrads mean that being there can feel like college p2  if you’re into that
Negative_Review: where to start     i decided to take this role after deep disenfranchisement with a previous  even lower paying role drove me to make the leap  and for starters  i have to give the category specialist program credit for this  that title means absolutely nothing to other companies  which  when transitioning out of walmart  can be a positive if you’re good at spinning  that said  this role is a massive  irredeemable *poop* show  much has been said about the massive workload and how little good training there is (and that’s all true) but people don’t point out how many terrible  ineffective  mind numbing  useless trainings css are regularly pulled into  the kind of stuff that does absolutely nothing for your performance in the role while sapping away hours you could spend on your actual job  not that your actual job is well defined  recruitment and management totes the program as an opportunity to run a small business within walmart  but when higher ups casually decide to consolidate categories or eradicate key resources  those words ring hollow    this is known by every single person involved in the category program  but what distinguishes this role from stupid but bearable to stupid and utterly intolerable is your manager  i had three over the course of my time  one insisted that they weren’t a micromanager while constantly peering over my shoulder and  at times  going over my head to make changes to my own category  another that paid no attention  and another who was actually a graduate of the cs program and knew what they were talking about  whether your manager likes you and whether they’re willing to shield you from the bs that upper management demands out of the blue is central to your experience  i’ve seen high performing css sacked merely because the manager didn’t like them personally  i’ve seen css speak with their manager about improving their performance  coming up with plans to do so  and still being fired before they have time to implement anything  managers almost always place optics above true growth  much less their team’s career development   important side note  unlimited pto is almost always a scam  but that is especially the case at walmart  there is this “blackout period ” which department heads will try to play up as something fun  in reality  it is a three month period at the end of the year where pto is virtually forbidden for all css  as pressure to perform on black friday and cyber monday ramps up  yes  this applies to categories that do not see spikes in business during the holidays  yet they’re paradoxically asked to be there for “morale ” not only that  if your business is seasonal  like fans or any patio product  congratulations  you have two blackout periods  there are categories that aren’t allowed to take pto for five months of the year    this company is so fickle  you may be talking to a cross functional partner one day about plans for the business and on the next day see that their entire department was dissolved   and not from an internal memo  but on the news (see  hayneedle)  you may think walmart is a safe  stable company to join  especially amidst all of the startups in the bay area  but you’d be wrong  i know that the labor market can be tough  but if you can  avoid this company like the plague  it does not care about you or your wellbeing

Title: "You're Not Allowed A Personal Life"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time
Positive_Review: easy to get  hired  easy to become a full time employee  regular hours  great starting pay  you acquire vacation and sick pay quickly  medical  dental and optical benefits for full time employees
Negative_Review: no discipline for lazy workers  not enough praise for hard workers  no personal life tolerance (ex  if you're late you recieve half a point  if you leave early you recieve 1/2   1 point depending on how early you leave  miss a day 1 point  you only get 5 points on your record before termination  and in a 6 month period you'll only get 1 point taken off your record  the second you go over your points you're terminated no matter how long you've been there or how much of an emergency you had in your personal life) just as easy to get fired  and sometimes they wont pay you out for the sick pay you've acquired after you're terminated or you quit  even if you havent used any of it  management is also allowed to tell you that you cant use the sick pay that you've acquired if they want to  it's another way for them to control your personal life  they could easily deny you sick pay if they feel like it  which will give you a point if you dont have protected sick time to cover your shift  you arent allowed to miss any days of work without severe consequences

Negative_Review: don't expect to get holidays off  the store is only closed on christmas day   the new attendance policy is very harsh  i had no issue i showed up but other asociates did especially those with children   sometimes they had me close then immediatley open the next day   lots of people at walmart quit without their 2 week notice  this happened a few times in my department it got hectic because i was called to fill in which i did  but it got tiring   some customers are rude

Title: "Going To Miss Everyone"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for less than a year

Negative_Review: ~your schedule  bounces way too much  may work from 3pm to 11pm and turn around and be back at 7am   ~temporary seasonal position seems to be what they hire for  so you are let go before you reach the 90 day mark   ~ being treated like your not smart enough or wanted by one and only one front end csm    ~not knowing if the store will hire you back or not for the time frame they advised to give them   ~ not being able to take advantage of the walmart benefits that are available to associates   ~knowing that the majority of all the store associates was hired as temporary seasonal associates that was offered a permanent position   ~ knowing that an associate that transferred in from another store  is allowed to keep their job even though they do not do there job and has been reported to upper management   takes longer than 15 min brakes ( 30 or 45 min)  lunch is one hour and associate takes over that hour

Title: "Anti Employee"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 3 years
Positive_Review: where i live it is one of the only employers and one of the highest wages
Negative_Review: there are very few full time positions and corporation wide they are instituting policies to downsize what are left and get rid of many of the remaining full timers  they often only offer less than 30 hours a week for part time employees  they are severely understaffed  but claim the opposite  floor employees are required to man registers at the call of code spark and will often get stuck at a register for hours  then get in trouble for not finishing their assigned tasks  store manager plays favorites  slackers are ignored despite it being known they are slackers  workers are pressured to over perform to compensate  everything faster  with more being expected daily with less people and less hours

Negative_Review: terrible management will go around scanning everything to order  not realizing just how much will be actually coming in on the same day  simple supply/demand that they would create through a balancing loop   *management running the supercenter like a market store *not one best way  the food all comes frozen  basically  so everyone feels like it doesn't matter which ones are cooked first     *you see cockroaches and all the secret grime that seems to grow overnight even with temporary help everywhere influencing them to crawl out of the abyss

Title: "Specialist IV"

Title: "Good starting job, don't recommend long-term"
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart part-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: some managers are very understanding and flexible with my changing schedule due to being in college decent pay starts at $9/hr mostly friendly associates sometimes they give us food
Negative_Review: other managers are very rude and inconsiderate none of the managers are on the same page   each one says something different and makes it extremely frustrating for the associates just trying to do their jobs when we get in trouble by one manager for doing something another manager told us to do a lot of gossip and drama between associates pto takes a long time to earn  especially being part time you'll basically get fired if you're sick too much must work holidays and don't get any extra compensation   if we work thanksgiving all we get is an extra 15% discount but nothing for other holidays (except christmas being the one day a year the supercenters close) favoritism is used in advancement opportunities many associates do not care about their jobs and provide horrible customer service which makes those of us who do work hard look bad rules and policies constantly change making it confusing for everyone the constant fear of being robbed in the parking lot and inside the store (mine has been robbed twice in the last two weeks)

Title: "Absolutely the worst company I’ve ever worked for"

Title: "NOT WORTH IT!"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: -pays well but you re worked to death  -can choose schedule 3 day  4 day or 5 day work week
Negative_Review: 1 ) work you to death like a slave in a field for what they pay so you're working extra hard for every single penny since they had to up the pay due to the strike years ago  2 ) company stock purchase plan aint worth crap  they tell you it's 15% match but after fees and all is said and done it's more like 5% if you're lucky  max is only like $300/year  3 ) management does not care about the employees as long as you're out of their hair  extremely lazy and insubordinate but when you bring it up to hr or upper management it's tossed aside and you're a pariah  nothing gets resolved as long as they're making the big bucks period! 4 ) lower the production percent requirement and stop being so greedy  5 ) stop making order fillers clean up after each other  if it needs cleaning either hire someone or take someone off production so they can clean it

Title: "Good pay and decent benefits for the industry;  Very little sense of accomplishment, unrealistic expectations."
Description_of_duration: I have been working at Walmart full-time for more than 10 years
Positive_Review: $1 a day corporate college tuition assistance with no strings attached  lots of opportunity for advancement  affordable benefits  good pay  discount programs  safe and clean working environment  great veteran and student support policies  world wide locations
Negative_Review: inconsistent store leadership and poor execution of corporate initiatives in stores   training and development not supported by managers  over tasked (impossible to complete any given direction to its fullest)   high turnover  threats of accountability for performance unrelated to the position  no room for creative input from individuals (you're basically a puppet on a string and expected to execute unquestionably)  total disconnect from corporate's "ideal" agenda for store standards and processes and the actual reality of day to day operations in the stores  authoritative leaders ("do this or else"  "my way or no way"  etc )  poor applicant pool  little concern for work  life balance (especially for salaried positions  who work 60 to 80 hrs a week and frequently get their days off taken from them)   lots of bad managers who are unqualified for roles who use fear tactics to drive results

Title: "Minimum Wage, no holiday pay, 5-10 day work week with no overtime.  Horrible bosses"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for more than a year
Positive_Review: can do your shopping after work   10% off non food items
Negative_Review: low pay  no holiday pay  malicious scheduling  schedule constantly changing cancelling out weekends and make you work past your 5 day schedule without overtime  i  had to work 13 out of 15 days without overtime   the overall atmosphere is awful  alot of long term unhappy employees griping day in day out

Title: "Observations of a diesel mechanic"
Description_of_duration: I worked at Walmart full-time for less than a year
Positive_Review: my first impression was that the shop had a relaxed atmosphere  since there was always someone s music selection playing fairly loudly  my judgment was premature  as i would later realize  you will go through a plethora of out-dated training material  and you will be tested on some of that material  the fleet assist system being used tracks a technician s time down to the minute  and they require accuracy to that precision  for example  if you take a lunch break  you have exactly 30 minutes  if you are more than 1 minute late arriving to work  it s considered an  occurrence   there are no lunch options within a reasonable drive accessible within the time window you are allotted  this means you will have to take your lunch daily  this also means that the time waiting for a microwave  combined with the time to cook frozen food items  may result in a rushed  prison style  meal  they also require two 15 minute breaks daily  once again down to the minute  they do have cable tv in the break room  but it s somewhat redundant since you have to watch the time closely  the list of absolutes and rules is quite exhaustive  and many of the seemingly ridiculous ones result in immediate termination  if violated  it will be expected to grasp and operate within the fleet assist system fairly quickly  and not much leniency will be given for the fact that your first 2 weeks consists mainly of training in other areas   the job itself doesn t seem to involve much heavy engine work  although i did replace a clutch during my brief tenure  most of the work is repetitive  and involves a great deal of physical labor  tires are handled in-house  so expect to replace/repair tires fairly frequently  they do provide uniforms  which is good since you will likely get very dirty   to put my pay into context  i came in as a  level 3 tech    my personal opinions/conclusions are as follows    1 ) if i m going to engage daily in that type of physical labor  i would at least prefer a more relaxed lunch period  consolidated to a full hour  i d rather work on flat rate than have my time scrutinized with the precision expected of a navy seal  i have an excellent attendance record throughout my lengthy career  but the time management  combined with the high-security compound reminds me of a gulag  the atmosphere is somewhat cult-like   2 ) even a car dealership gives its employees 5 - 6 paid holidays per year  at walmart  you will only get christmas  they argue that your pto acts in place of your holidays  but that s no enormous consolation to a new employee who starts during the holiday season and has no pto    3 ) they provide your tools  but since multiple shifts share the same sets  you will have no  home base  where you might store your rechargeables  phone  gloves  clipboard  etc  i d prefer to have my own box so that i can operate from my own personal space    4 ) the pay is decent for the market  but i can earn similar on the automotive side  with cleaner work  lighter parts  closer commute  and less stress involving logistics  these come at the trade off of higher volume  but i would consider it a good trade  even if i was looking to continue in commercial service  i would choose a less uptight environment   5 ) apparently  some techs really like it  i m not sure how much of that is a function of relative location  and lack of competition within their relative commute radius  but they have several techs with over 10 years tenure  they have had several retire from there  on the other hand  they have quite a few techs (the largest grouping) with less than one year  who i presume to be transient   6 ) lastly  they had a meeting to discuss employee survey results/actionable items  during which the upper management made a statement about those past employees who were caught in violation of various policies as  we had to get rid of them  of course   that freudian slip speaks volumes about how upper management regards its employees
Negative_Review: please see above  the above commentary is identical to the review i left on another job platform  and i didn't want to reformat it
